meanings.definition: Anesthesia administered into the space outside the dura mater of the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: During childbirth, some women choose to have an epidural to help with the pain.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended an epidural to numb the lower part of the body for surgery.
meanings.sent3: The epidural made the patient feel like they were floating on a cloud.
meanings.sent4: The epidural was a magic potion that took away all discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The epidural acted like a shield against the sharp sensations.

meanings.definition: Relating to or situated on or over the dura mater.
meanings.sent1: The epidural injection was carefully placed near the spinal cord.
meanings.sent2: The epidural region of the spine was marked for further examination.
meanings.sent3: The epidural layer seemed to glow under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as warm and comforting as an epidural blanket.
meanings.sent5: The epidural connection between the nerves was crucial for the surgery.
